content: 2023 Caribbean Treasures 125,000 Satoshi Copper BarsThe Caribbean Treasures 125k Copper bar is a beautiful way to stack sats. The bars will ship unfunded and will be funded once the buyer safely has them in hand. This price includes funding and shipping within the USA. Purchases from over seas will need additional funding. PM for options. Buy a tube of .  I have ppff, venmo and cashapp if needed. Material: CopperDenomination: 125,000 SatsShape: Rectangle 1 oz barWeight: 28.3 GYear: 2023Mintage: TBD

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: What is the serial number range? It says max 1000 but I see one with serial above 1000

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES

comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on April 27, 2023, 11:09:14 PMWhat is the serial number range? It says max 1000 but I see one with serial above 1000I probably should put together a list of all my pieces. There are many, but for 2023 it looks like this.....Silver prototypes Â  Â 0001-0050Brass 10K Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 0051-0999 Â reserved through 0999Copper 125k Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 1000-1999 Â reserved through 1999 Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  This hologram will be retired after holo #3000. I will come out with a new one after that and make any improvements if needed. If I need to make more brass 10k sat pieces, I will start them again with Hologram #2000  Fractional silver pieces will be coming soon and those will have different holos due to the size. doing a collaboration with another maker. Bullion-n-BTC

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: I really like tiny precious metal bars in general and these do look particularly nice. Quote from: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES on April 27, 2023, 05:57:34 PMDamn, so pretty!Is this also a bundle price similar to the brass coins you released or just for one bar? The latter would be too steep for me for just one 1oz of copper.

comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on April 28, 2023, 06:13:30 AMI really like tiny precious metal bars in general and these do look particularly nice. Quote from: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES on April 27, 2023, 05:57:34 PMDamn, so pretty!Is this also a bundle price similar to the brass coins you released or just for one bar? The latter would be too steep for me for just one 1oz of copper.Thanks! You should always save money if you buy in bulk. I have tubes of 15. Buying in tubes of 15 saves me 5 hours of work, which will save you money. : The price isn't steep though. Name one physical crypto bar on the market that you can get fully funded on monetary metal for a better price? These are under $100. The rest is just funding and shipping cost. I buy redeemed round alt pieces for more Â . But the answer to your question is Yes. I can lower the price if you buy a tube. Â PM for bulk pricing.

comments.author: tread93
comments.body: These look cool! How much are the silver prototypes going to run you? I hope I won't have to walk the plank to get one!!! HahahahhaGreat quality on these copper bars, I wonder what type of machinery you're using to develop these?

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: Quote from: tread93 on April 28, 2023, 05:58:39 PMThese look cool! How much are the silver prototypes going to run you? I hope I won't have to walk the plank to get one!!! HahahahhaGreat quality on these copper bars, I wonder what type of machinery you're using to develop these? Thanks! The silver prototypes aren't available anymore. We'll at least not through me. Some people bought multiples and may sell one. Haha I haven't had anyone walk the plank yet, but that does sound like a fun jungle swimhole party. I'd like to move into a direction of crudely made pieces...not in quality, but in style. Like it was made long ago or at the mouth of a gold mine using only fire and hammers. Maybe people wouldn't be afraid to handle them and have them as pocket pieces to show others. ðŸ¤”Â  silver pieces that don't leave finger prints when you touch it.....so maybe an antique matte finish with no proofing. We shall see. These copper bars are nice though. Almost to nice and they make you want to put them in a case and not touch them.

comments.author: tread93
comments.body: Quote from: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES on April 28, 2023, 09:08:46 PMQuote from: tread93 on April 28, 2023, 05:58:39 PMThese look cool! How much are the silver prototypes going to run you? I hope I won't have to walk the plank to get one!!! HahahahhaGreat quality on these copper bars, I wonder what type of machinery you're using to develop these? Thanks! The silver prototypes aren't available anymore. We'll at least not through me. Some people bought multiples and may sell one. Haha I haven't had anyone walk the plank yet, but that does sound like a fun jungle swimhole party. I'd like to move into a direction of crudely made pieces...not in quality, but in style. Like it was made long ago or at the mouth of a gold mine using only fire and hammers. Maybe people wouldn't be afraid to handle them and have them as pocket pieces to show others. ðŸ¤”Â  silver pieces that don't leave finger prints when you touch it.....so maybe an antique matte finish with no proofing. We shall see. These copper bars are nice though. Almost to nice and they make you want to put them in a case and not touch them.Â  Bummer I missed out on that! I actually may be able to give you some pointers on how to make your own COBs. I've made some out of silver before its not too difficult with the right tools. I think you're onto something there m8, it really fits your theme too. Having the feel of a genuine shipwrecked silver piece or x marks the spot buried treasure. Not the same style of an 8 reale i'm guessing or gold escudo but something with the antiqued finish that you can hold would be a great change up from the plastic coin cases we are utterly scared of even opening in fear of ruining or damaging any coins. Haha.
